@ryan-jd It's not exactly a bodge fix. It's just the nature of floating point math. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1458633/how-to-deal-with-floating-point-number-precision-in-javascript

https://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/exact-change

Hey Pete and KD, I completed the challenge 'exact change' (front end - advanced algorithm scripting) but to get it to work I had to use (Math.round(num*100))/100 when comparing the numbers as sometimes I would get say 0.009999 left over so would need to round it to get that penny otherwise it would not have sufficient funds. Just a bit concerned that it may have been a bodge fix for something I did wrong elsewhere in the program. I can send my code if you don't mind/think you can help?

@AlanGabbianelli sounds good, when did you finish and how are the job prospects looking?

@Spacecamel100 the Makers experience is great! It's very intensive and challenging, I was there 9am to 8pm (often even later), but also very satisfying. The curriculum is studied to push you to learn a huge amount of stuff in those 12 weeks. You pair program since day one and apply agile methodologies and best practises, TDD, BDD... Don't expect lessons or lectures though, the only interactions with the coaches are during the standups (morning and afternoon) or if you get stuck. So you have to be willing to research the answers.
Ok @cajogos we can talk about it on Thursday.
eyeing it up myself :D

I am obviously also working my way through FCC at the same time, but would be cool if anyone was interested as it will definitely boost your skills and CVs for potential jobs :) Oh and FCC does support CoderDojo already, so win-win xD

Well we are a study group for people on FCC. ##Please note that we now recommend campers use their Campsite‚Äôs Facebook group for chatting instead of their campsite‚Äôs Gitter chatroom. 
We are doing this because few of our Campsite Gitter chatroooms have active synchronous discussions, and about 1/3rd of conversations consist of someone saying ‚Äúhello‚Äù and not getting a response. Most of the discussions are asynchronous, which Facebook posts and group messages are better suited for.
We‚Äôve removed this Gitter room from our Campsite directory. Still, we will keep it open for archival purposes, and you can keep using it if you‚Äôd like.
Here‚Äôs a short blog post about how our Campsites are evolving and growing: http://blog.freecodecamp.com/2015/09/jump-start-your-local-campsite-with-coffee-and-code.html
